questions.question_text:
Production of iron in blast furnace follows the following equation

Fe3O4(s) + 4CO(g) $$\to$$ 3Fe(l) + 4CO2(g)

when 4.640 kg of Fe3O4 and 2.520 kg of CO are allowed to react then the amount of iron (in g) produced is :

[Given : Molar Atomic mass (g mol$$-$$1) : Fe = 56, Molar Atomic mass (g mol$$-$$1) : O 
 = 16, Molar Atomic mass (g mol$$-$$1) : C = 12]
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
Production of iron in blast furnace follows the following equation 
Fe_{3}O_{4}(s) + 4CO(g) $$\to$$ 3Fe(l) + 4CO_{2}(g) 
when 4.640 kg of Fe_{3}O_{4} and 2.520 kg of CO are allowed to react then the amount of iron (in g) produced is : 
[Given : Molar Atomic mass (g mol^{$$-$$1}) : Fe = 56, Molar Atomic mass (g mol^{$$-$$1}) : O 
 = 16, Molar Atomic mass (g mol^{$$-$$1}) : C = 12]

[Given : $$\ln 10 = 2.3$$, R = 8.3 J K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1]

questions.question_text: Let $$S = \{ z \in C:|z - 2| \le 1,\,z(1 + i) + \overline z (1 - i) \le 2\} $$. Let $$|z - 4i|$$ attains minimum and maximum values, respectively, at z1 $$\in$$ S and z2 $$\in$$ S. If $$5(|{z_1}{|^2} + |{z_2}{|^2}) = \alpha  + \beta \sqrt 5 $$, where $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are integers, then the value of $$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$ is equal to ___________.

questions.question_text: Let y = y(x) be the solution of the differential equation $${{dy} \over {dx}} + {{\sqrt 2 y} \over {2{{\cos }^4}x - {{\cos }^2}x}} = x{e^{{{\tan }^{ - 1}}(\sqrt 2 \cot 2x)}},\,0 2 is equal to ___________.

If $$y\left( {{\pi  \over 3}} \right) = {{{\pi ^2}} \over {18}}{e^{ - {{\tan }^{ - 1}}(\alpha )}}$$, then the value of 3$$\alpha$$^{2} is equal to ___________.

questions.question_text: $$50\tan \left( {3{{\tan }^{ - 1}}\left( {{1 \over 2}} \right) + 2{{\cos }^{ - 1}}\left( {{1 \over {\sqrt 5 }}} \right)} \right) + 4\sqrt 2 \tan \left( {{1 \over 2}{{\tan }^{ - 1}}(2\sqrt 2 )} \right)$$ is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text: Let $$H:{{{x^2}} \over {{a^2}}} - {{{y^2}} \over {{b^2}}} = 1$$, a > 0, b > 0, be a hyperbola such that the sum of lengths of the transverse and the conjugate axes is $$4(2\sqrt 2  + \sqrt {14} )$$. If the eccentricity H is $${{\sqrt {11} } \over 2}$$, then the value of a^{2} + b^{2} is equal to __________.

questions.question_text: Let b1b2b3b4 be a 4-element permutation with bi $$\in$$ {1, 2, 3, ........, 100} for 1 $$\le$$ i $$\le$$ 4 and bi $$\ne$$ bj for i $$\ne$$ j, such that either b1, b2, b3 are consecutive integers or b2, b3, b4 are consecutive integers. Then the number of such permutations b_{1}b_{2}b_{3}b_{4} is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R :

Assertion A : The photoelectric effect does not takes place, if the energy of the incident radiation is less than the work function of a metal.

Reason R : Kinetic energy of the photoelectrons is zero, if the energy of the incident radiation is equal to the work function of a metal.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
options.B: Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
options.C: A is correct but R is not correct.
options.D: A is not correct but R is correct.

questions.question:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R : 
Assertion A : The photoelectric effect does not takes place, if the energy of the incident radiation is less than the work function of a metal. 
Reason R : Kinetic energy of the photoelectrons is zero, if the energy of the incident radiation is equal to the work function of a metal. 
In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.

questions.question_text: A block of metal weighing 2 kg is resting on a frictionless plane (as shown in figure). It is struck by a jet releasing water at a rate of 1 kgs$$-$$1 and at a speed of 10 ms$$-$$1. Then, the initial acceleration of the block, in ms$$-$$2, will be :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A block of metal weighing 2 kg is resting on a frictionless plane (as shown in figure). It is struck by a jet releasing water at a rate of 1 kgs^{$$-$$1} and at a speed of 10 ms^{$$-$$1}. Then, the initial acceleration of the block, in ms^{$$-$$2}, will be :

questions.question_text: In van der Waal equation $$\left[ {P + {a \over {{V^2}}}} \right]$$ [V $$-$$ b] = RT; P is pressure, V is volume, R is universal gas constant and T is temperature. The ratio of constants $${a \over b}$$ is dimensionally equal to :
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: Two vectors $$\overrightarrow A $$ and $$\overrightarrow B $$ have equal magnitudes. If magnitude of $$\overrightarrow A $$ + $$\overrightarrow B $$ is equal to two times the magnitude of $$\overrightarrow A $$ $$-$$ $$\overrightarrow B $$, then the angle between $$\overrightarrow A $$ and $$\overrightarrow B $$ will be :
questions.subject: Physics

questions.question_text: The escape velocity of a body on a planet 'A' is 12 kms$$-$$1. The escape velocity of the body on another planet 'B', whose density is four times and radius is half of the planet 'A', is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The escape velocity of a body on a planet 'A' is 12 kms^{$$-$$1}. The escape velocity of the body on another planet 'B', whose density is four times and radius is half of the planet 'A', is :

questions.question_text: A longitudinal wave is represented by $$x = 10\sin 2\pi \left( {nt - {x \over \lambda }} \right)$$ cm. The maximum particle velocity will be four times the wave velocity if the determined value of wavelength is equal to :

questions.question_text: A positive charge particle of 100 mg is thrown in opposite direction to a uniform electric field of strength 1 $$\times$$ 105 NC$$-$$1. If the charge on the particle is 40 $$\mu$$C and the initial velocity is 200 ms$$-$$1, how much distance it will travel before coming to the rest momentarily :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A positive charge particle of 100 mg is thrown in opposite direction to a uniform electric field of strength 1 $$\times$$ 10^{5} NC^{$$-$$1}. If the charge on the particle is 40 $$\mu$$C and the initial velocity is 200 ms^{$$-$$1}, how much distance it will travel before coming to the rest momentarily :

questions.question_text: Using Young's double slit experiment, a monochromatic light of wavelength 5000 $$\mathop A\limits^o $$ produces fringes of fringe width 0.5 mm. If another monochromatic light of wavelength 6000 $$\mathop A\limits^o $$ is used and the separation between the slits is doubled, then the new fringe width will be :
questions.subject: Physics

If another monochromatic light of wavelength 6000 $$\mathop A\limits^o $$ is used and the separation between the slits is doubled, then the new fringe width will be :

questions.question_text: Two coils require 20 minutes and 60 minutes respectively to produce same amount of heat energy when connected separately to the same source. If they are connected in parallel arrangement to the same source; the time required to produce same amount of heat by  the combination of coils, will be ___________ min.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two coils require 20 minutes and 60 minutes respectively to produce same amount of heat energy when connected separately to the same source. If they are connected in parallel arrangement to the same source; the time required to produce same amount of heat by  the combination of coils, will be ___________ min.

questions.question_text:
The intensity of the light from a bulb incident on a surface is 0.22 W/m2. The amplitude of the magnetic field in this light-wave is ______________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$9 T.

(Given : Permittivity of vacuum $$\in$$0 = 8.85 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$12 C2 N$$-$$1-m$$-$$2, speed of light in vacuum c = 3 $$\times$$ 108 ms$$-$$1)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
The intensity of the light from a bulb incident on a surface is 0.22 W/m^{2}. The amplitude of the magnetic field in this light-wave is ______________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$9} T. 
(Given : Permittivity of vacuum $$\in$$_{0} = 8.85 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$12} C^{2} N^{$$-$$1}-m^{$$-$$2}, speed of light in vacuum c = 3 $$\times$$ 10^{8} ms^{$$-$$1})

questions.question_text: As per the given figure, two plates A and B of thermal conductivity K and 2 K are joined together to form a compound plate. The thickness of plates are 4.0 cm and 2.5 cm respectively and the area of cross-section is 120 cm2 for each plate. The equivalent thermal conductivity of the compound plate is $$\left( {1 + {5 \over \alpha }} \right)$$ K, then the value of $$\alpha$$ will be ______________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: As per the given figure, two plates A and B of thermal conductivity K and 2 K are joined together to form a compound plate. The thickness of plates are 4.0 cm and 2.5 cm respectively and the area of cross-section is 120 cm^{2} for each plate. The equivalent thermal conductivity of the compound plate is $$\left( {1 + {5 \over \alpha }} \right)$$ K, then the value of $$\alpha$$ will be ______________.

questions.question_text: A body is performing simple harmonic with an amplitude of 10 cm. The velocity of the body was tripled by air jet when it is at 5 cm from its mean position. The new amplitude of vibration is $$\sqrt{x}$$ cm. The value of x is _____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A body is performing simple harmonic with an amplitude of 10 cm. The velocity of the body was tripled by air jet when it is at 5 cm from its mean position. The new amplitude of vibration is $$\sqrt{x}$$ cm. The value of x is _____________.

questions.question_text: The variation of applied potential and current flowing through a given wire is shown in figure. The length of wire is 31.4 cm. The diameter of wire is measured as 2.4 cm. The resistivity of the given wire is measured as x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 $$\Omega$$ cm. The value of x is ____________. [Take $$\pi$$ = 3.14]
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: The variation of applied potential and current flowing through a given wire is shown in figure. The length of wire is 31.4 cm. The diameter of wire is measured as 2.4 cm. The resistivity of the given wire is measured as x $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$3} $$\Omega$$ cm. The value of x is ____________. [Take $$\pi$$ = 3.14]

questions.question_text: $$\sqrt {{d_1}} $$ and $$\sqrt {{d_2}} $$ are the impact parameters corresponding to scattering angles 60$$^\circ$$ and 90$$^\circ$$ respectively, when an $$\alpha$$ particle is approaching a gold nucleus. For d1 = x d2, the value of x will be ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: $$\sqrt {{d_1}} $$ and $$\sqrt {{d_2}} $$ are the impact parameters corresponding to scattering angles 60$$^\circ$$ and 90$$^\circ$$ respectively, when an $$\alpha$$ particle is approaching a gold nucleus. For d_{1} = x d_{2}, the value of x will be ____________.

questions.question_text: A parallel beam of light is allowed to fall on a transparent spherical globe of diameter 30 cm and refractive index 1.5. The distance from the centre of the globe at which the beam of light can converge is _____________ mm.
questions.subject: Physics
